section.title: Available Constants
section.para: When using Majisti_Application, a set of available constants are declared by default. These are the only trade off you get for using the framework, along with those of Zend. Anyhow, these constants are based on common standards, and will prove very usefull in any application.

note.para: Note that within Majisti, every paths do not contain the ending slash, this is to simplify path concatenation.

row.entry: This is where the application folder resides inside a project. This is an absolute path. Ex: /var/www/MyProject/application
This is where the library folder resides in a project Ex: /var/www/MyProject/library
The application environnement based on what was setup in the application's htaccess. Usually development, production testing, staging.
This is the base url of the application. This is an alias to the http request Zend_Controller_Request_Http::getBaseUrl() function. Ex: /MyProject/public

This is really important since this is the public access to the library. AJAX scripts, stylesheets or images can be accessed directly with the autodetected URL or by specifying a DNS. Commonly, static.hostname.com is usually the DNS that points to the public library. If not, http://hostname:port/Majisti/public will be used
